EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Use-case: Smelting basic materials.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace (position: (0.0, 0.0))
– Iron Chest (position: (1.5, 0.5))

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (–16.0, –51.0)
Use-case: Extraction and preliminary processing of iron ore.
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill (position: (–16.0, –51.0)) [status: WORKING, fuel: {'coal': 4}, energy: 2666.67; warning: output blocked by item on the ground – no sink entity available]
– Burner Inserter (position: (–14.5, –49.5)) [status: WORKING, fuel: {'coal': 2}, pickup position: (–15.5, –49.5), drop position: (–13.5, –49.5)]
– Transport Belt (position: (–15.5, –49.5))
– Iron Chest (output sink) (position: (–13.5, –49.5)) [status: NORMAL, stored inventory: {'iron-ore': 23}]
– Burner Inserter (position: (–14.5, –47.5)) [status: WAITING_FOR_SOURCE_ITEMS, fuel: {'coal': 1}]
– Iron Chest (position: (–13.5, –47.5)) [status: NORMAL]

### Copper Furnace at position (–27.0, –60.0)
Use-case: Processing copper ore.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace (position: (–27.0, –60.0)) [warning: no ingredients to smelt]

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Use-case: Supporting research through integrated power and fluid supply.
Consists of:
– Lab (position: (0.5, 2.5)) [status: NO_POWER]
– Offshore Pump (position: (–7.5, 25.5)) [status: WORKING; contains water]
– Boiler (position: (2.0, 17.5)) [status: NOT_CONNECTED; warnings: no input liquid, no fluid present]
– Steam Engine (position: (5.5, 5.5)) [status: NOT_CONNECTED; warnings: not connected to power network, no input liquid, no fluid present]

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Use-case: Manufacturing of pipes.
Consists of:
– Assembling Machine (position: (3.5, 0.5)) [status: NO_POWER; warnings: not receiving electricity, cannot create pipe due to missing resource: iron-plate]
– Iron Chest (position: (1.5, 0.5))
– Electricity Network via Small Electric Poles (e.g., at positions (3.5, –1.5), (3.5, 2.5), (4.5, 3.5), …) forming an integrated Electricity Group

### Fluid Pipelines (Pipe Groups)
Use-case: Interconnecting fluid transport components.
Consists of multiple PipeGroups distributed across the map (e.g., at positions (8.5, 5.5), (10.5, 4.5), (2.5, 9.5), (1.5, 11.5), (–1.5, 17.5), (6.5, 16.5), (–1.5, 21.5)) and notably a working PipeGroup (e.g., at (–9.5, 9.5))

### Integrated Components
Use-case: Facilitate power distribution and link mined resources.
Consists of:
– Belt connections linking the Burner Mining Drill to output chests (e.g., the Transport Belt at (–15.5, –49.5))
– An Electricity Network integrated with Small Electric Poles forming an Electricity Group

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• Output Sink Placement Issues
  – Validate candidate positions (e.g., (–13.0, –49.5), (–13.5, –48.5), (–13.0, –48.5)) to ensure they are free of obstructions and buildable before attempting to place an Iron Chest for output collection.
  – Confirm that the chosen sink location permits seamless deposit of mined ore from the Burner Mining Drill.
• Crafting Ingredient and Resource Shortages
  – Verify that all required sub-ingredients (such as iron-plate for crafting Transport Belts) are available before initiating crafting routines.
  – Ensure production facilities (e.g., furnaces) are properly supplied with raw materials and fuel so that ingredient generation meets crafting demands.
• Furnace Resource Insufficiency
  – Check that sufficient raw ore and fuel (Iron Ore and Coal) are present in inventory before engaging in smelting operations.
• Fluid Connectivity and Intermediate Placement (Retained)
  – Continue to ensure that fluid connection points between entities (like the Offshore Pump and Boiler) remain unobstructed and correctly aligned.

────────────────────────
NAMESPACE
• get_entity(entity: Any, position: Any) -> Any  
  – Retrieves an entity of the specified type at the given position.
   • Success: Returns the located entity.
   • Failure: Raises an exception if the entity is not found.
• pipe_entity(pipe: entities.Pipe) -> Any  
  – Processes a pipe entity during pipeline connection routines.
• rotate_entity(entity: Any, direction: Any) -> Any  
  – Rotates the given entity to the specified direction for proper alignment.
• insert_item(resource: Any, target: Any, quantity: int) -> Any  
  – Inserts a specified quantity of a resource into the target inventory.
• get_connection_amount(virtual_candidate: Any, boiler_connection: Any, pipe_proto: Prototype.Pipe) -> int  
  – Calculates the number of pipe segments required to establish a fluid connection.

Important Variables:
• pump_working (OffshorePump) – Holds the offshore pump entity at position (–7.5, 25.5).
• boiler_original (Boiler) – Represents the boiler entity at position (2.0, 17.5).
• candidate_intermediate_offpump (Position) – Candidate connection point for linking the Offshore Pump.
• candidate_intermediate_boiler (Position) – Candidate connection point for linking the Boiler.
• boiler_connection_point (Position) – Intended connection point for the boiler’s water supply.
• steam_engine_connection_point (Position) – Intended connection point for the Steam Engine’s input.
• pipe_count (int) – Tracks the current number of available pipes.
• distance (float) – Calculated distance for pipeline segments.
• final_inventory (Inventory) – Snapshot of inventory item counts after recent operations.
• virtual_candidate (Position) – Virtual candidate connection point used for manual pipe placement.
